body_html: I'm terribly confused by this issue. In the original error message, python_op_gen_main.cc is crashing when invoked by a genrule to create a Python wrapper for contrib/ffmpeg:decode_audio_op because it can't load Cuda due to SIP? I'm not sure why that tool needs to link Cuda, which is clearly build messiness. But why would SIP prevent linking Cuda?
body_text: I'm terribly confused by this issue. In the original error message, python_op_gen_main.cc is crashing when invoked by a genrule to create a Python wrapper for contrib/ffmpeg:decode_audio_op because it can't load Cuda due to SIP? I'm not sure why that tool needs to link Cuda, which is clearly build messiness. But why would SIP prevent linking Cuda?
body: I'm terribly confused by this issue. In the original error message, [python_op_gen_main.cc](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/python_op_gen_main.cc) is crashing when invoked by a genrule to create a Python wrapper for contrib/ffmpeg:decode_audio_op because it can't load Cuda due to [SIP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/System_Integrity_Protection)? I'm not sure why that tool needs to link Cuda, which is clearly build messiness. But why would SIP prevent linking Cuda?
